sen.j: 伊達 宗高（だて むねたか、慶長12年（1607年） - 寛永3年8月17日 (旧暦)（1626年10月7日））は江戸時代の武将。
sen.e: Munetaka DATE (1607 - October 7, 1626) was a busho (Japanese military commander), who lived during the Edo period.
Munetaka DATE (1607 - October 7, 1626) was a Japanese military commander who lived during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 武将→a Japanese military commander"who"の前のカンマは特に必要ないので、削除しました。
sen.e: Munetaka DATE (1607 - October 7, 1626) was a Japanese military commander who lived during the Edo period.
He was the family head of the Murata Date clan.
He was the head of the Murata Date clan.
sen.cmt: 村田伊達氏当主→the head of the Murata Date clan
sen.e: He was the head of the Murata Date clan.
He was the seventh son of Masamune DATE.
He was the seventh son of Masamune DATE.
He was the seventh son of Masamune DATE.

sen.j: 母は柴田宗義の娘・阿山方。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of Muneyoshi SHIBATA, Ayama no kata (Lady Ayama)
sen.cmt: 阿山方→"Ayama no kata (Lady Ayama)"としました。
sen.e: His mother was Ayama no kata (Lady Ayama), daughter of Muneyoshi SHIBATA.
His mother was Ayama no kata (Lady Ayama), daughter of Muneyoshi SHIBATA.

sen.j: 官位は諸大夫、従五位下、右衛門大尉。
sen.e: His official court rank was Shodaibu (aristocracy lower than Kugyo [high court noble]), Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Uemon no Taijo (Senior Lieutenant of Right Division of Outer Palace Guards).

He held the office of Uemon no Taijo (Senior Lieutenant of Right Division of Outer Palace Guards) as Shodaibu (fourth and fifth-rank officials) and rose to the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 官位は→He held the office of（「諸大夫」は位階を示し、「右衛門大尉」が役職を示すので、左記の表記としました。）諸大夫→Shodaibu (fourth and fifth-rank officials)
sen.e: He held the office of Uemon no Taijo (Senior Lieutenant of Right Division of Outer Palace Guards) as Shodaibu (fourth and fifth-rank officials) and rose to the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His childhood name was Choshomaru (長松丸).
sen.cmt: 長松丸→"Choshomaru (長松丸)"としました。
sen.e: His childhood name was Choshomaru.
sen.cmt: 漢字名の記載は特に必要ないと解釈し、削除しました。
sen.e: His childhood name was Choshomaru.

sen.j: 7歳で村田要害館主となり柴田・刈田3万石を領した。
sen.e: At the age of 7, he became the lord of Murata Yogai Fortress and owned Shibata and Katta Countries with a total stipend of 30,000-koku crop yield.
sen.cmt: 村田要害→"Murata Yogai Fortress"としました。領した→"owned"としました。
sen.e: At the age of 7, he became a lord of Murata Fort and owned Shibata and Katta Counties with a total stipend of 30,000-koku crop yield.
sen.cmt: 要害→Fort「柴田・刈田」→Shibata and Katta Counties
sen.e: At the age of 7, he became a lord of Murata Fort and owned Shibata and Katta Counties with a total stipend of 30,000-koku crop yield.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)9年（1623年）に噴火した蔵王連峰を鎮めようと天に命願して人々を救ったとされ、村田（現：宮城県柴田郡村田町）では伝説の名君として名を残している。
sen.e: It is said that when the Zao Mountain Range erupted in 1623, he saved the people, he asked to the heaven to calm the mountain, and in Murata Village (present Murata-cho, Shibata-gun, Miyagi Prefecture), therefore, to date the people have handed down his name as a legendary wise ruler.
sen.cmt: 天に命願して→"asked to the heaven"としました。村田→"Murata Village"としました。
sen.e: Since it is believed that he saved people by asking the heaven with heart and soul to calm the eruption of Zao Mountain Range in 1623, he is still called legendary wise ruler in Murata Village (present-day Murata-cho, Shibata-gun, Miyagi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: ～とされ→It is believed that（「人々を救ったと信じられているため、名君として名を残している」ので、変更しました。）名を残している→still called（「未だに～と呼ばれている」の意味となるので、簡潔な表現に変更しました。）
sen.e: Since it is believed that he saved people by asking the heaven with heart and soul to calm the eruption of Zao Mountain Range in 1623, he is still called legendary wise ruler in Murata Village (present-day Murata-cho, Shibata-gun, Miyagi Prefecture).

sen.j: 官位を受領後、天然痘にかかり京都二条要法寺にて客死。
sen.e: After he was conferred an official rank, during the stay in Kyoto he had smallpox, and died at Yohoji-Temple in Nijo, Kyoto.
After he was conferred an official rank, he suffered from smallpox and died at Yobo-ji Temple at Nijo, Kyoto, away from home.
After he was conferred an official rank, he suffered from smallpox and died at Yobo-ji Temple at Nijo, Kyoto, being away from home.

sen.j: その時、10名の家臣が殉死した。
sen.e: At that time, ten vassals serving him followed their master to the grave.
At that time, 10 of his vassals followed to the grave.
sen.cmt: 10名の家臣→10 of his vassals（アラビア数字に訂正し、簡潔な表現にするため、"serving him"の代わりに"his vassals"としました。）殉死する→follow to the grave（"vassal"の表記があるので、"master"を用いない表現に変更しました。）
sen.e: At that time, 10 of his vassals followed to the grave.

sen.j: 宗高の死後、後嗣がなく村田伊達家は断絶となった。
sen.e: After Munetaka's death, the Murata Date family became extinct, as the family did not have any inheritor.
After Munetaka's death, the Murata Date family became extinct because of no inheritor.
sen.cmt: 「後嗣がなく」は、表現を簡潔にするため、"because of no inheritor"に変更しました。
sen.e: After Munetaka's death, the Murata Date family became extinct because of no inheritor.

sen.j: 墓所は村田町の龍島院。
sen.e: His graveyard is located in Ryuto-in Temple in Murata-cho.
His graveyard is located in Ryuto-in Temple in Murata-cho.
His graveyard is located in Ryuto-in Temple in Murata-cho.

sen.j: 村田町では現在でも命日に「宗高公まつり花火大会」が開催されている。
sen.e: In Murata-cho, 'Munetaka-ko Matsuri Hanabitaikai' (Lord Munetaka commemorative fireworks display) is celebrated even today on the anniversary of his death.
sen.cmt: 「宗高公まつり花火大会」→"'Munetaka-ko Matsuri Hanabitaikai' (Lord Munetaka commemorative fireworks display)"としました。
sen.e: In Murata-cho, 'Munetaka-ko Matsuri Hanabitaikai' (Lord Munetaka Commemorative Fireworks Display) is held on the anniversary of his death even now.
sen.cmt: 「宗高公まつり花火大会」→'Munetaka-ko Matsuri Hanabitaikai' (Lord Munetaka Commemorative Fireworks Display)
sen.e: In Murata-cho, 'Munetaka-ko Matsuri Hanabitaikai' (Lord Munetaka Commemorative Fireworks Display) is held on the anniversary of his death even now.
